bboxes.raw_text:
ST. LOUIS = A lO6 yr. old man
was arrested Tuesday and held
on an assault charge after stab
bling his housekeeper 20 times.


James Whittenburg and his
housekeeper. a 81 yr. old woman
have been arguing and fighting for
several months.


He attacked her with a knife
and she was in critical condition
after police found her lying in
a pool Of blood.


Whittenburg said he was prize
fighter in 1880 and he Is the
Oldest person ever jailed in the
city.

Old N an


Stubs Wom an

NEW YORK The National
Association for the Advancement
of Colored People has published
a 44-page illustrated booklet con-
tanning collection of biograph-
ical sketches of famous nine
teenth century Negroes.


The Informative booklet is
based on weekly series of bio
graphical sketches which were
prepared and distributed as part
of the NAACPs regular press
service to some three hundred
daily and weekly papers. Mildred
Bond is author of the series.


Expressions of appreciation
and commentator were wide
spread" remarks Mr.. wilkins
in the foreword, "and a great
many persons urged that we COM
pile the series in a single vol
ume for more general distribu-
tion. This we have DONE"


Printed in three colors, the
text of the booklet is enriched
by Is original drawings by James
l. DeLoache. Mr.. DeLoache, who
has had a lifelong interest in
telling the Negroes story with
canvas and paints. is creator Of
the NAACPs massive mural
"Our New Day Begun" The
murla. which is insured for
$4,000, depicts Negro life in
America since slavery, and is
now on display in the Educational
Building at the New York Worlds
Fair.


"Negro Heroes Of Emancipa-
ton is being sold at the NAACP
National Office in New York City
as we'll as the groups l.725
units throughout the country. De-
pending upon the quantity or
dered, prices range from $l.00
for one copy to so cents each for
fifty or more copies.

WASHINGTON = Chester C..
Carter, 43-year-old Negro law
yer and former Peace Corps Of
fetal. was appointed as deputy
chief of the State Department S
protocol office.


The first of his race to hold
top position in protocol, Carter
will move from the post of deputy
assistant secretary for congress
sional affairs. Before joining the
State Department. he was direc-
tor of Peace Corps activities
in Tunisia and the Comeroons in
Africa.


In the protocol office, Carter
will specialize in the accredi-
tation of ambassadors, in priv
ileges and immunities for dip
lomats and in ceremonial affairs.


The protocol office decides
such matters as who sits where
at state dinners but it has been
active also in combating racial
discrimination in Washington
and neighboring states.

The Arizona Civil Liberties
Union, northern area, urge the
Phoenix Union High School Sys-
tenn to accept the offer of gift
subscriptions to Human Events.


The board of education has re-
ferred to a faculty committee the
offer subscriptions to the conser-
vative magazine. The Unions
views we're contained in a letter
to Superintendent Seymour from
Ted Mote, State President of Ari-
iona Gu. The letter stated:


1.-THE board of the Northern
Area ACLU is in full support
of academic freedom and OPP
posed to censorship. 1t is our
belief that school libraries should
make available to students and
faculties the broadcast selection
possible of journals of opinion,
including such magazines as HUI
man Events. Materials should not
be barred from Libraries Simply
because they present controver-
sial or unpopular points of view."

ACLU Urges
High School


To Accept Magazine

Mrs. Arthur Oe Mccoy Chapman was selected as The
Arizona Tribune "Mother of the Year,


resident of the for the years. spent same
house Chapman Road Mrs. Mccoy many her
time to her family church. school and community.


The mother Of three children Willie Francsco
daughters Mrs. Dorothy Scott Phoenix


There are l3 grandchildren


Her mother Mrs. Lester right lives next
door to her.


From left in the photograph Mrs. Mccoy CRYSTAL
Cynthia S. Constance and Mrs. Bessie Lester Byron
months Standing Mrs. Wendell Dorothy Scott, Clifford,
BURNS, IL, and Arthur Mccoy. 4He
Mrs. Mccoy has served president of Pamdae School
years week for the fifth





For II years she president Junior auxiliary
Willow Grove Baptist Church.


She is president Junior
division of SRVD of Baptist Churches.
Mrs. Mccoy is the grand Chapter
affiliate Of NV St. Johns Grand Lodge.


She always many Health and
March of Dimes campaigns.


She is Boy Scouts troop assistant.
For several years she Palmdae School bus,

Booths will display sporting
goods. canned goods, household
articles, and clothing.


Edward Kuykendall is the car
nival chairman.

NEW YORK : Rep. Adam C.
Powell, D. New York, was grant
ed another delay in answering a
sac, 500 judgment.


The judgment is held by Mrs.
Esther James, Harlem widow,

who was awarded $211,50O dam
ages against him because he
called her "bag woman (graft
collector for police).


The award was reduced but
Powell has not paid nor sub
mitted a report of his assets.

Wesley Methodist Church, 1902
E. Washington will hold its first
annual Embarrassing carnival and
bazaar at the church, May Is
and 10, S pm. to midnight.

night held Friday the Elks Lodge.
1907 South 9TH Mrs. Helen Walker cochairman
with Mrs. Charlesetta McClammy.
First prize by The Varseles.


Participants included from left Phdela Gaines Marva Walter
Jackson Turner Deleanor Sutton
and Sharon Jackson second place.
